snippet: The University of Arizona law school is accepting GRE scores for admissions consideration, much to the chagrin of the LSAT council.
abstract: Legal experts wrangle over decision by University of Arizona James E Rogers College of Law to accept students who took GRE graduate admissions exam instead of Law School Admissions test; university’s policy change garners support from 150 law school deans but Law School Admissions Council, overseers of law school application process, says it might expel Arizona school from its network.
lead_paragraph: The University of Arizona law school is accepting GRE scores for admissions consideration, much to the chagrin of the LSAT council.

headline.main: Law School’s Acceptance of GRE Test Scores Provokes Tussle
headline.print_headline: The GRE for Law School? A Gatekeeper Has Qualms
